title: Slack synchronization
content: Click the button to start the Slack synchronization. Localhost cannot and does not receive messages. Log in with another account or as a visitor to perform your tests.

title: Workspace
content: The workspace name you are using to synchronize Slack.

title: Bot Access Token
content: You will get this code by completing the Slack synchronization.

title: User Access Token
content: You will get this code by completing the Slack synchronization.

title: Channel ID
content: This is your main Slack channel ID, which is usually the #general channel. You will get this code by completing the Slack synchronization.

title: Agent linking
content: Link each Support Board agent with the corresponding Slack user, so when an agent replies via Slack it will be displayed as the assigned Support Board agent.

title: Test Slack
content: Send a test message to your Slack channel. This only tests the sending functionality of outgoing messages.

title: Archive channels
content: Archive all user channels generated by Support Board in the Slack app. If you have a lot of channels, this operation may take a long time to complete. Important: All of your slack channels will be archived.

title: Disable inviation
content: Disable the automatic inviation of agents to the channels.
